required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the effects of desflurane and propofol anesthesia on sleep quality of breast cancer patients after operation

detailed_description.textblock: Objective to explore the relationship between anesthesia and postoperative sleep quality, and to observe whether desflurane anesthesia is not inferior to propofol anesthesia in patients undergoing elective radical mastectomy

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: propofol group and desflurane group 1-3 days after operation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: before operation, 4-7 days after operation and 1 month after operation

secondary_outcome.measure: Total sleep time (TST), rapid eye movement time (REM), wake-up time after sleep
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before operation and within 1 week after operation

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of functional connectivity (FC) and structural connectivity (SC) in resting state fMRI
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before operation, 3 days after operation and 1 month after operation

arm_group.description: Anesthesia maintenance: desflurane inhalation (mac1.0-1.2) sufentanil 0.3-0.5 μ g / (kg · h) atracurium CIS benzenesulfonate 1-3 μ g / (kg · min)
Anesthesia maintenance: propofol TCI: 3-4ug / ml sufentanil 0.3-0.5 μ g / (kg · h) cisatracurium besylate 1-3 μ g / (kg · min)

intervention.description: Objective To observe the effect of desflurane on postoperative sleep quality of patients undergoing elective radical mastectomy. Methods 124 patients undergoing elective radical mastectomy were randomly divided into two groups: Propofol group and desflurane group

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- （1）The operation time is 3-4 hours (2) Age 30-75 years old, BMI 18.5-25.0kg/m2, ASA grade I or II (3) There was no depression (MDI < 21) and cognitive impairment (MMSE ≥ 27) before operation (4) Those who voluntarily participate in the research and sign the informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- (1) The patients received adjuvant chemotherapy before operation (2) At present, they are taking psychoactive, opioid, anti anxiety and hypnotic drugs (3) Known or treated patients with apnea syndrome (4) Patients with other cancers
